_meta.description: Alex Cognitive Architecture — Recommended MCP Server Catalog (v5.9.0)
_meta.purpose: VS Code MCP server configurations that Alex agents are optimized to use. Copy desired servers into your .vscode/mcp.json file.

azure-mcp._description: Azure resource management — used by the Azure agent for subscriptions, resources, and deployments

github-mcp._description: GitHub repository access — file reading, PR review, issue management

filesystem-mcp._description: Local filesystem access — for reading project files outside the workspace

playwright-mcp._description: Browser automation — for web research and UI validation tasks

instructions: 1. Enable MCP gallery in VS Code: set 'chat.mcp.gallery.enabled': true in .vscode/settings.json
2. Create a .vscode/mcp.json file in your project
3. Copy the server configurations you need from 'servers' above into your mcp.json
4. Set environment variables for any servers that require authentication
5. VS Code will auto-discover and start the MCP servers when you open the workspace
